page.title: 04CULMSTOCK FLORA - IN HEDGES
page.content: Within the ancient boundaries of Culmstock there is a vast variety of flora much of which is retained because of the still traditional pattern of local agriculture. Hedges are massive earth banks _ layered in the past but now mechanically cut back. Intertwined with bramble, honeysuckle, clematis, hop, black bryony, bittersweet, dogrose and trailing rose, we find willow, holly, may, blackthorn, alder, elder, hazel, cherry, dogwood, spindle, tutsan and guelder.Trees on the earthbanks, with exposed roots, provide a habitat for a variety of ferns - such as, hart's tongue, polypod and male fern and also navelwort, wood sorrel, 'town hall clock' and foxgloves. Indeed, Culmstock with its normally mild and moist climate is rich in Flora.
